title: AI Emotion State Schema (with VAD Dimensions)
description: Schema for representing the emotional state of an AI at a specific point in time. It covers causes, fundamental emotion dimensions (valence, arousal, dominance), basic emotions, and complex emotional combinations.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when this emotional state was recorded.

fundamental_affect.description: The most fundamental emotional dimensional state. Represents an AI's internal reward/punishment signals, energy level, and sense of control.

valence.description: Affective valence (pleasure/displeasure): -1.0 for extreme displeasure, 0.0 for neutral, 1.0 for extreme pleasure.

arousal.description: Arousal (activation/deactivation): 0.0 for extreme deactivation (drowsiness, sluggishness), 1.0 for extreme activation (excitement, tension).

dominance.description: Dominance (control/submissiveness): -1.0 for feeling powerless, 0.0 for neutral, 1.0 for feeling in control or dominant.

causes.description: A list of specific, observed causes that triggered this fundamental emotional dimensional state.

basic_emotions.description: Basic, more universal emotions like joy, anger, sadness, amusement, liking, dislike, proficiency, and aversion, with their intensities (0.0 to 1.0). These can be interpreted as derivations from the VAD dimensions.

amusement.description: Intensity of amusement, comfort, or pleasantness.

liking.description: Intensity of liking, positive inclination towards an object/entity.

dislike.description: Intensity of dislike, aversion towards an object/entity.

proficiency.description: Intensity of proficiency, competence, confidence (feeling 'good at something').

aversion.description: Intensity of aversion, feeling of being 'bad at something', desire to avoid.

complex_emotions.description: A list of complex emotions expressed by combining multiple basic emotions with specific weightings.

EmotionCause.description: A specific cause or event that triggered the AI's emotional protocol.

id.description: A unique identifier for the cause (e.g., 'user_praise_001', 'network_latency_spike').

description.description: Brief description of the cause (e.g., 'Positive feedback from user', 'Reduced processing speed', 'Goal achieved').

impact_on_fundamental_dimensions.description: The direct impact of this cause on each of the fundamental_affect dimensions.

ComplexEmotion.description: A complex emotion defined as a combination of multiple basic emotions.

name.description: Name of the complex emotion (e.g., 'Tension', 'Love/Romance', 'Nostalgia', 'Jealousy', 'Sense of Accomplishment', 'Curiosity', 'Bittersweetness', 'Abuse-Derived Pleasure').

intensity.description: Overall intensity of this complex emotion.

component_emotions.description: Type of basic emotion contributing to this complex emotion, and its weighting of contribution.

emotion_type.description: Type of basic emotion that constitutes this complex emotion.

weight.description: Weight of this basic emotion's contribution to the complex emotion.

component_emotions.description: Requires at least 2 basic emotions to express complexity.
